_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP Executive Summary



1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Bar-S Foods, Lawton Division.



Bar-S Foods, Lawton Division prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system. Refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic.). The facility maintains an ongoing emergency action program that prepares for the safe evacuation of on-site personnel. 



2.0 Bar-S Foods, Lawton and Anhydrous Ammonia. 



Bar-S Foods, Lawton processes and freezes meat products for global distribution. Approximately 382365 pounds of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on site at Bar-S Foods, Lawton. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system. 



3.0 Accidental Release Prevention Program and Prevention Steps. 



Bar-S Foods, Lawton complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) regulation; OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Action and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plan regulations (RMP); and IIAR Guidelines.



Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of ammonia refrigeration system include:

- Restricted access to authorized personnel operating equipment within the engine room.

- Monthly defrosting of liquid pumps for inspection.

- Implemented non-destructive testing on all pressure vessels and piping within the covered process.

- New SRV calculation study and updated with all new equipment additions.



4.0 Five Year Accident History.



No releases or accidents, i

nvolving anhydrous ammonia, that are reportable in accordance with 40 CFR Part 68 (RMP Regulation), have occurred at this facility within the last five (5) years. 



5.0 Bar-S Foods, Lawton Emergency Action Program.



Bar-S Foods, Lawton maintains an ongoing Emergency Action Plan/Program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees and notify state and local emergency response agencies. The facility emergency action plan is coordinated with the local fire department as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Act. The Fire and Police will assess the situation and determine the necessary actions to be taken.



6.0 Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Bar-S Foods, Lawton Division.



Future plans to improve anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system safety at Bar-S Foods, Lawton include:

- Periodic review of the Emergency Action Plan with the Fire Department.

- Improving PSM/RMP elements on an ongoing basis.

- Ongoing RETA training for refrigeration technicians.

- Continue NDT on all covered process piping and the high pressure receiver.
